question: Next on his checklist are wax glues to stick the feathers together. If the feathers require 469 g of wax and right now he just needs 257 g, how many grams of wax glue does he already have?
response:
The image shows that the person needs 469 g of wax glue and currently has 257 g of wax glue. To find out how many grams of wax glue he already has, we can subtract the amount he needs from the amount he currently has:

469 g - 257 g = 212 g

The answer is 212 g.
